user.description:
GLÃœCKWUNSCH! Die iCloud3 v3 Integration wurde zu Home Assistant hinzugefÃ¼gt. Der nÃ¤chste Schritt ist die Konfiguration der GerÃ¤te, welche nachverfolgt werden sollen. Falls iCloud3 v2 ausgefÃ¼hrt wird, your configuration will be migrated from v2 to v3

Select SUBMIT below, then select CONFIGURE to configure iCloud3.


-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
The iCloud3 User Guide will help you get started:
â€¢ ICLOUD3 DOCUMENTATION - Select the question mark (?) in the upper-right
  corner of this screen to open the â€œiCloud User Guideâ€
â€¢ MIGRATING FROM v2 - Follow the steps in the â€œInstalling iCloud3 > Migrating
  from v2 to v3â€ chapter
â€¢ NEW INSTALLATION - Folge den Schritten im Kapitel â€œInstalling iCloud3 > As a new
  Installationâ€
-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --

data_source.title: Apple Account & Mobile App - Datenquelle
data_source.description: The data sources provide location and other information iCloud3 uses to track the iDevice.

data.username: BENUTZERNAME - E-Mail-Addresse/Benutzername fÃ¼r die Anmeldung am Apple Account
data.server_location: APPLE SERVER STANDORT - Das Land, welchen den Apple Server von diesem Account hostet
data.totp_key: TOTP KEY - Time Based One-Time Password Key used to generate the 6-digit authentication code
data.locate_all: LOCATE ALL DEVICES (Trifft nur bei mehreren Apple Accounts zu)
data.url_suffix_china: CHINA USERS - Use Apple iCloud Servers located in China (.cn URL suffix)

data_description.locate_all: AKTIVIERTâ†’Locate the Owner's & other Family members devices in the Apple Acct. DISABLEDâ†’Locate the Owner's devices. Do not locate other Family members devices.

data.device_action: â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯ HOW SHOULD DEVICES ASSIGNED TO THIS APPLE ACCT BE HANDLED

reauth.title: Apple ID BestÃ¤tigugnscode
reauth.description: Enter the 6-digit verification code you just received from Apple

device_list.title: iCloud3-GerÃ¤te
device_list.description:
Up to 10 devices can be tracked or monitored by iCloud3. They are listed here.

This screen is used to select a device that needs to be updated, add a new device and delete a device that should not be tracked any longer.

data.ic3_devicename: ICLOUD3 DEVICE_TRACKER ENTITY ID - The HA device_tracker entity for this device. (Example: gary_iphone)
data.fname: ANZEIGENAME - Displayed in HA entities and on the Event Log (Example: Gary-iPhone)
data.famshr_devicename: APPLE ACCOUNT iCLOUD DEVICE  - Apple iCloud device providing location data
data.mobile_app_device: MOBILE APP DEVICE_TRACKER ENTITY - Mobile App device providing location data & zone triggers
data.picture: FOTO - Bild der Person, welche normalerweise dieses GerÃ¤t verwendet (44x44 Pixel ist eine passende GrÃ¶ÃŸe)
data.icon: ICON - Icon, welches angezeigt wird, wenn kein Foto ausgewÃ¤hlt wurde (=None)
data.tracking_mode: TRACKING MODE - Location request method (Tracked, Monitored, Inactive)
data.mobapp: MOBILE APP INSTALLIERT - HA Mobile App is installed on this device

data_description.ic3_devicename: This is the device_tracker entity you are assigning to the iCloud3 device you want to track.

update_device.title: Update iCloud3-GerÃ¤t
update_device.description: This screen lets you configure each of the devices that can be tracked or monitored using iCloud3

data.ic3_devicename: ICLOUD3 DEVICE_TRACKER ENTITY ID - The HA device_tracker entity assigned to this device
data.fname: ANZEIGENAME - Displayed in HA device_tracker and sensor names and on the Event Log
data.famshr_devicename: APPLE ACCOUNT iCLOUD DEVICE  - Apple iCloud device providing location data
data.mobile_app_device: MOBILE APP DEVICE_TRACKER ENTITY - Mobile App device providing location data & zone triggers
data.picture: FOTO - Bild der Person, welche normalerweise dieses GerÃ¤t verwendet (44x44 Pixel ist eine passende GrÃ¶ÃŸe)
data.icon: ICON - Icon to display when the Picture has not been selected (=None)
data.tracking_mode: TRACKING MODE - How location requests should be done (Full tracking, Monitor, Inactive)
data.rarely_updated_parms: DISPLAY RARELY UPDATED PARAMETERS - Check and Submit to update these items
data.log_zones: ZONE LOG ACTIVITY - Enter/exit zone info (date, time, distance) is saved to a spreadsheet .csv file
data.track_from_zones: TRACK-FROM-ZONES - Track travel time & distance from Home and other zones
data.track_from_base_zone: TRACK-FROM-HOME ZONE OVERRIDE - Use this zone instead of the Home for tracking results

data_description.inzone_interval: Time between location requests when in a zone
data_description.fixed_interval: A fixed time between location requests when not in a zone. iCloud3 calculates the interval for the next locate request and uses the calculated value if this is not set (= 0). This value will NOT be used when the calculated interval is less than 5-min, the current location data is old, the device is off-line or when the device is not in a zone.
data_description.track_from_base_zone: Normally, the Home zone is used as the primary Track-from-Zone for all tracking (travel time, distance, etc).  However, a different zone can be used as the primary Track-from-Zone if you are away from Home for an extended period or the device is normally at another location (vacation house, second home, parent's house, etc.). This can be set Globally for all devices on the Special Zones screen.

update_other_device_parameters.title: Update Other Device Parameters
update_other_device_parameters.description: This screen updates device parameters that are rearely updated

data.ic3_devicename: ICLOUD3 DEVICE_TRACKER ENTITY ID - The HA device_tracker entity assigned to this device
data.fname: ANZEIGENAME - Displayed in HA device_tracker and sensor names and on the Event Log
data.tracking_mode: TRACKING MODE - How location requests should be done (Full tracking, Monitor, Inactive)
data.log_zones: ZONE LOG ACTIVITY - Enter/exit zone info (date, time, distance) is saved to a spreadsheet .csv file
data.track_from_zones: TRACK-FROM-ZONES - Track travel time & distance from Home and other zones
data.track_from_base_zone: TRACK-FROM-HOME ZONE OVERRIDE - Use this zone instead of the Home for tracking results

data_description.inzone_interval: Time between location requests when in a zone
data_description.fixed_interval: A fixed time between location requests when not in a zone. iCloud3 calculates the interval for the next locate request and uses the calculated value if this is not set (= 0). This value will NOT be used when the calculated interval is less than 5-min, the current location data is old, the device is off-line or when the device is not in a zone.
data_description.track_from_base_zone: Normally, the Home zone is used as the primary Track-from-Zone for all tracking (travel time, distance, etc).  However, a different zone can be used as the primary Track-from-Zone if you are away from Home for an extended period or the device is normally at another location (vacation house, second home, parent's house, etc.). This can be set Globally for all devices on the Special Zones screen.

review_inactive_devices.title: Review Untracked (Inactive) Devices
review_inactive_devices.description: The 'Tracking Mode' of devices are set to 'Inactive' and will not be located or tracked.

change_device_order.title: Event Log Device Display Sequence
change_device_order.description:
The devices are displayed in the Event Log heading area and in various Event Log messages in the sequence below.

This screen lets you change the order of the devices.

picture_dir_filter.title: Bilderverzeichnisfilter einrichten
picture_dir_filter.description: Auwahl der \www Verzeichnisse, welche nach Bilddateien (png, jpg) durchsucht werden sollen

away_time_zone.title: Display Location Time Zone when Away
away_time_zone.description:
The time displayed in the Event Log and Sensors show the time an event took place using the Home 'time zone' from your Home Assistant computer.  When you are away from Home and in another time zone, your tracking events are still based on the time at your Home 'time zone', not time in your current location.

This screen lets you display time events using your current location's time zone.

data.away_time_zone_1_offset: Time & Time Zone Adjustment at Current Location #1
data.away_time_zone_2_offset: Time & Time Zone Adjustment at Current Location #2

data_description.time_zone_1_offset: PRIMARY DEVICES & LOCATION TIME - Devices and the current location time when away and in another time zone
data_description.time_zone_2_offset: SECONDARY DEVICES & LOCATION TIME - Devices and the current location time when away and in another time zone

dashboard_builder.title: iCloud3 Dashboard Builder
dashboard_builder.description: This will create a Dashboard for iCloud3 tracked devices and the Event Log in several formats. The dashboard that is created is a normal HA Dashboard that you can customize using the HA Dashboard tools. There are 5 tabs with different styles that you can use as-is or as a source to build your own.

data.styles:
The styles are:
1. Left > Device Info (#1, #2) as a complete sensor group, Right > Event Log
2. Left > Badge Sensor, Device Tracking Results (#1, #2), Battery, Right > Event Log
3. Left > Device Info as a individual sensor groups; Right > Event Log
4.  Left > Device Info  (#1, #2) as a complete sensor group; Right >  Device Info (#3, #4) as a complete sensor group

5. Event Log by itself

tools.title: Maintenance Tools
tools.description: Maintenance Tools can be used update the iCloud3 configuration files to correct errors, reset the configuration their default values, reload iCloud3, restart Home Assistant, etc.

data.log_level_devices: RAWDATA LOG DEVICE FILTER - Write iCloud RawData to the log file for only these devices
data.log_level: LOG LEVEL - The type of messages that are written to the iCloud3 Log file (icloud3.log}

tracking_parameters.title: Tracking Parameters
tracking_parameters.description: Many parameters are used when tracking a device and displaying the results. These include how poor GPS Accuracy should be handled, various polling interval values and zone distances used to set the time to locate the device. They are customized on this screen.

data.distance_between_devices: USE LOCATION RESULTS FROM A NEAR-BY DEVICE
data.travel_time_factor: TRAVEL TIME INTERVAL AND NEXT LOCATION UPDATE MULTIPLIER
data.discard_poor_gps_inzone: DISCARD POOR RESULTS - Discard Location Updates with Poor GPS Accuracy when in a Zone

data_description.old_location_threshold: Lokationen Ã¤lter als dieser Wert werden verworfen
data_description.old_location_adjustment: Add this to the time that determines if a location is old
data_description.distance_between_devices: When tracking results are updated, any nearby devices are identified. When tracking results for those devices are updated, the tracking results of the one originally updated can be used instead. This improves performance since the Waze route time and distance are not requested again
data_description.gps_accuracy_threshold: Locations with GPS Accuracy above this value will be discarded
data_description.tfz_tracking_max_distance: Normally the Home zone's time and distance data is displayed on the Device's device_tracker and sensor entities. Display the Track-from-Zone instead when the Device is within this distance of the Track-from-Zone
data_description.max_interval: The maximum time between location requests
data_description.exit_zone_interval: The time to the first location request after exiting a zone
data_description.mobapp_alive_interval: Send a location request to the Mobile App if there has been no contact after this amount of time. This will check to see if the Mobile App is responding to location requests or is asleep and not running.
data_description.offline_interval: Location request interval when offline (Airplane mode, dead cell area, etc.)
data_description.travel_time_factor: This is used to calculate the Interval and Next Location Time when going towards Home. A smaller value will reduce the interval time and increase the location requests, a larger value will increase the interval and reduce the location requests.

format_settings.title: FELDFORMATE & ANDERE PARAMETER
format_settings.description:
Tracking activity, results and information messages are displayed in the Event log, sensors and device_tracker entities for tracked and monitored devices.

This screen us used to specify how these results should be displayed.

data.display_zone_format: EVENT LOG ZONE DISPLAY NAME - How the Zone name is displayed in sensors and the Event Log
data.device_tracker_state_source: DEVICE TRACKER STATE VALUE - How the device's device_tracker entity state value is determined
data.time_format: ZEITFORMAT - How time fields are displayed in sensors and in the Event Log
data.unit_of_measurement: UNIT OF MEASUREMENT - How distance fields are displayed in sensors and in the Event Log
data.display_gps_lat_long2: DISPLAY GPS COORDINATES - Display the GPS (Latitude, Longitude/Â±Accuracy) or only the GPS (/Â±Accuracy) in the Event Log
data.display_gps_lat_long: DISPLAY GPS COORDINATES - Display GPS-(22.32771, -76.33073/Â±35m) instead of GPS-/Â±35m in the Event Log
data.apple_server_location_needed: APPLE SERVER LOCATION - Display Apple Server Location Selection field on Apple Acct Username/Password screen (China, Hong Kong)
data.picture_www_dirs: PICTURE DIRECTORY FILTER - Select the directories containg Device image files (.png, .jpg)
data.event_log_card_directory: EVENT LOG CARD LOVELACE RESOURCES DIRECTORY - Event Log custom card .js file directory
data.event_log_btnconfig_url: EVENT LOG CONFIGURE BUTTON (GEAR) URL > Special URL that display's the HA Configure Settings screen

data_description.picture_www_dirs: iCloud3 scans the /www for all picture files (.png, .jpg) to build a table for selecting the picture for a device. The picture can be hard to find if you have many image files in many directories. Specify the directories with your device image files here
data_description.device_tracker_state_source: HA uses the device's gps coordinates to determine the zone. The gps accuracy is not considered so the zone may be exited when the gps wanders out of the zone. iCloud3 does consider the gps accuracy and will not exit the zone when this occurs. iCloud3 will display the Zone's Friendly Name or zone name displayed on the Event Log
data_description.event_log_btnconfig_url: Normally, this is blank and iCloud3 will determine the URL for it's Configure Settings screen. However, if there is a problem caused by running HA in a virtual environment, docker or on another device and the actual URL can not be detemined, a 404 not found error may be encountered. If that happens, select it the normal way (HA Devices & Services > Integration > iCloud3 > Configure Settings gear) and copy the URL from the browser into this field.

display_text_as.title: Event Log 'Display Text As'
display_text_as.description:
There may be some text fields, such as email addresses or phone numbers, that are displayed on the Event Log screen that are private and should not be displayed. For example, you can replace 'geekstergary@apple.com' with 'gary@email.com'.

This screenis used to specify the original text and the text that should be displayed.

data.display_text_as: â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯ TEXT REPLACEMENT FIELDS - [Actual text > Displayed text]

display_text_as_update.title: Update Event Log 'Display Text As' Value

data.text_from: ORIGINALER TEXT - Text to be replaced (example: gary_real_email@gmail.com)
data.text_to: ANGEZEIGTER TEXT- Text to be displayed (display:  gary@email.com)

inzone_intervals.title: inZone Parameters and Default Intervals
inzone_intervals.description:
An inZone interval is the time between location requests when the Device is in a zone.

 This screen is used to set the default values for different types of devices. This value is assigned to a device when it is added.

Note: The inZone Interval can be set to a different value on the Update Device screen for each device.

data.distance_between_devices: Determine the distance between devices. Use a near by device's tracking results

data_description.no_mobapp: Standardintervall if the Mobile App is not used for location monitoring and zone enter/exit triggers

data.waze_region: ROUTE SERVER LOCATION - Location of the Waze Route Server for your area
data.waze_realtime: ECHTZEITDATEN VERWENDEN - Waze should consider traffic delays when determining travel time
data.waze_history_track_direction: GENERAL TRAVEL DIRECTION - Used to display 'Map Trace Lines' between saved locations

data_description.waze_min_distance: Use the Waze Route Service when the zone distance is greater than this value
data_description.waze_max_distance: Do not use the Waze Route Service when the zone distance is greater than than this value
data_description.waze_history_max_distance: Do not save the Waze travel time & distance to the Waze History Database if the distance is greater than this value

special_zones.title: Spezielle Zonen
special_zones.description:
This screen is used to configure:
  â€¢ Stationary Zones - Created when the device is in the same location for a short
    period of time
  â€¢ Enter Zone Delay Time - Delay processing a Zone Enter Trigger
  â€¢ A temporary â€œhomeâ€ zone at another location

data.stat_zone_fname: ANZEIGENAME BASIS - Name to display when in a Stationary Zone (StatZone)
data.track_from_base_zone: TRACK FROM ZONE - Use this zone instead of Home for tracking results for all devices. Global setting
data.track_from_home_zone: TRACK FROM HOME ZONE - Keep tracking from the Home zone when the Primary Track From Zone is not Home

data_description.passthru_zone_time: Delay processing an Enter Zone Trigger that you may be driving through and not actually entering
data_description.stat_zone_still_time: Time at the same location before moving into a Stationary Zone
data_description.stat_zone_inzone_interval: Time interval between location requests when in a Stationary Zone
data_description.stat_zone_fname: Display this value in the Event Log, device_tracker, travel direction and zone entities when the device is in a Stationary Zone. iCloud3 assigns a number to the Stationary Zone. Use the wildcard character '#' to display this value in the Stationary Zone's name (StatZon1, StatZon2, etc). Note: A 7-letter name leaves room for the name and number to be displayed on iPhone screens without being truncated.

sensors.title: Sensoren
sensors.description:
Many sensors are used to display tracking results and other information for a device.

 This screen is used to select the sensors that should be created.

data.monitored_devices: â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯ ÃœBERWACHTE GERÃ„TE SENSOREN - Select the type of sensors to create for a Monitored Device
data.device: â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯ GERÃ„TE SENSOREN - Device status and information
data.tracking_update: â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯ LOCATION UPDATE SENSORS - Device location update times
data.track_from_zones: â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯ TRACK FROM MULTIPLE ZONE SENSORS - Used when tracking from more than one zone (not needed for tracking only from the Home zone)
data.tracking_other: â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯ ANDERE TRACKING SENSOREN - Not normally used but available
data.zone: â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯ ZONEN SENSOREN - Device zone status and information
data.other: â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯ ANDERE SENSOREN - Sensors not in the above areas
data.excluded_sensors: â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯â¯ AUSGESCHLOSSENE SENSOREN - Sensors that will not be created when iCloud3 starts

exclude_sensors.title: Sensoren ausschlieÃŸen
exclude_sensors.description:
Many sensors are created for the devices but there may be times when you want to not create a sensor for a specific device. For example, you may want to create a bettery sensor for all devices except one.

This screen lets you specify the sensor entity name that should not be created.

data.excluded_sensors: AUSGESCHLOSSENE SENSOREN - Sensors that will not be created when iCloud3 starts
data.filter: FILTER DISPLAYED SENSORS - Select the Sensors that should be displayed
data.filtered_sensors: ICLOUD3 SENSOREN - A list of Sensors that are created when iCloud3 starts
